summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 between attorney Gloria Allred and federal prosecutors/FBI regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate a meeting for the victim to travel to New York for a victim services meeting on October 23, 2019, and discuss scheduling calls and interviews with law enforcement.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who emails prosecutors and FBI to announce she has a new client who is an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein and coordinates travel and meetings for the victim.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI agent copied on emails regarding coordination of victim services and travel logistics for the alleged victim's meeting.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: Mentioned as joining a scheduled conference call regarding the victim's case.

persons.name: Marianne Wang
persons.context: Attorney whose office is involved in the case; her associate Daniel is scheduled to join a call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator against whom the new client is an alleged victim.

connections.description: Allred represents a client who is an alleged victim of Epstein, creating a legal adversarial relationship.
Allred coordinates with FBI agent Young regarding victim services and logistics for her client's meeting.
Allred mentions co-counsel Marianne Wang's office being involved in the case, indicating a collaborative legal effort.

events.title: Victim Meeting in New York
events.description: A victim services meeting organized by the FBI in New York, which Gloria Allred's new client is willing to fly to attend.

events.title: Scheduled Conference Call
events.description: A planned conference call between Gloria Allred, prosecutors, FBI, and co-counsel to discuss the new alleged victim's case, which was later canceled and needed rescheduling.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048 (Allred, Maroko & Goldberg law office)
305 Broadway, New York, NY (Gloria Allred's office location for meeting)
Washington D.C. (Destination for Gloria Allred's travel after meeting)
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, informed federal prosecutors and the FBI in October 2019 that she had a new client who was an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The alleged victim was willing to fly to New York for a victim meeting organized by the FBI on October 23, 2019.

The emails show coordination between a victim's attorney and law enforcement (both prosecutors and FBI) regarding travel logistics and interview scheduling for a victim coming forward after Epstein's death.
The document indicates the ongoing investigation and victim outreach efforts by the Southern District of New York and FBI in late 2019, following Epstein's arrest and death.
Multiple email addresses and names of prosecutors/FBI agents are redacted in the text, indicating sensitive law enforcement communications.
